data: TM ED Critical Care Transfusion (Module)
Status
This powerplan is to be used in ED and Critical Care Areas ONLY
For Massive Transfusion call Tranfusion Medicine Service
For emergency unmatched blood, call TM
Medications
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus
50 mL, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: bag
Blood Products
Special requirements (e.g. irradiated) must be identified for red blood cell and platelet transfusion orders. For instructions for special requirements consult linked resource

Consider patient history:  1. Known blood antibodies (antibody card)  2. Blood disorder or a blood cancer such as leukemia, lymphoma, or myeloma  3. Transplant procedure  4. Immune deficiency disorder  5. Pregnancy within 90 days
Red Blood Cells
Group and screen required. (Sample expires every 3 days at 2359h on the third day following date of collection)
Blood Product Fact Sheet
Administer - Red Blood Cell Transfusion
Urgent, Administer: 1 unit, IV, Administer each over: 60 - 90 Minutes, Anemia - Hb <70 g/L, No Special Requirements, T;N
Urgent, Administer: 1 unit, IV, Administer each over: 60 - 90 Minutes, Anemia - Symptomatic, No Special Requirements, T;N
STAT, Administer: 1 unit, IV, Administer each over: 5 - 30 Minutes, Anemia - Active Bleeding, No Special Requirements, T;N
STAT, Administer: 2 unit, IV, Administer each over: 5 - 30 Minutes, Anemia - Active Bleeding, No Special Requirements, T;N
Nurse to place Lab Order
Nurse to place lab order for CBC post red blood cell infusion

Platelets
Order in doses. One adult dose is equivalent to 4 pooled units or 1 apheresis unit
Blood Product Fact Sheet - Pooled or apheresis platelets
Blood Product Fact Sheet - HLA matched platelets
Administer - Platelet Transfusion
Urgent, Administer: 1 Dose, IV, Administer each over: 60 - 90 Minutes, Plt < 50 Microvascular Bleed or Surgery, No Special Requirements, T;N
STAT, Administer: 1 Dose, IV, Administer each over: 30 to 60 Minutes, Plt < 50 Microvascular Bleed or Surgery, No Special Requirements, T;N
Nurse to place Lab Order
Nurse to place lab order for post platelet count 1 hour post transfusion
Plasma
Dose 10 to 15 mL/kg. 1 unit of plasma is approximately 250 mL
For Warfarin reversal, use Prothrombin Complex. For non-life threatening hemorrhage consider Vitamin K
Blood Product Fact Sheet
For Patients LESS than 70 kg
Administer - Plasma Transfusion
Urgent, Administer: 3 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Coagulopathy - Active Bleeding, T;N
Timed, Administer: 3 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Coagulopathy - High Risk of Bleeding
For Patients GREATER than 70 kg
Administer - Plasma Transfusion
Urgent, Administer: 4 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Coagulopathy - Active Bleeding, T;N
Timed, Administer: 4 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Coagulopathy - High Risk of Bleeding
Cryoprecipitate
Order product as per site procedure. Consultation with Pathologist is available. Contact TM
Cryoprecipitate is not available at all sites
Order in adult doses. Standard adult dose is 10 pooled units
Blood Product Fact Sheet
Administer - Cryoprecipitate Transfusion
STAT, Administer: 1 Dose, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Hypofibrinogenemia and Bleeding, T;N
Urgent, Administer: 1 Dose, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, Hypofibrinogenemia and Bleeding, T;N
Fibrinogen
Fibrinogen Concentrate is not available at all sites
Standard dose of fibrinogen is 4 g
